Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stayed here after her High School reunion down the street. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to go due to the central location of the hotel. The room was nice and we could see the ocean from our window. We didn't spend too much time in the room, but when we did it was comfortable and had everything we needed.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hampton Inn and Suites San Clemente
Summary: We had a wonderful time at the Hampton.   The staff was friendly.  The room was spacious and clean.  We didn't get to use the pool (why would one swim in a pool with the entire Pacific Ocean right down the road.)  We enjoyed ourselves, and the hotel took care of everything else.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: "The place to stay in San Clemente"
Summary: This is a great hotel.  This is my second time here this year.  My first stay was 118 nights, and most recent this stay was for 51 more.  Yes, I've slept here for 169 nights this year. The staff is the best I've encountered.  When I return to the area, I'll stay here again without a doubt.  You are treated like family here. July 1 thru August 21 was my most recent business trip.  If they had the Golf Channel, I would have no complaints at all.  kkkkkkkkkkkkk
Manager Response: none

Summary: Typical Hampton Inn - big, comfortable rooms and a decent breakfast. Don't know about all the other Hamptons but this one had free beers and nachos in the afternoon (perfect after a long ride). And the ladies at the reception desk were top notch. Polite, friendly and very efficient. They definitely set this Hampton apart from other hotels. I would absolutely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you!

Summary: Our daughter was married August 4th, 2012 in San Clemente (5 minutes away from the hotel).  We blocked 15 rooms and worked very closely with Donia Moore, General Manager and Rosalind Batterton, Front Office Manager for months in advance.  They were amazing people to work with and we felt  they exceeded the effort to make our weekend so special and it was.  The rooms were very clean, very spacious and completely operational.  The housekeeping staff was exceptional as they made it possible for the guests who requested early check in (before 3) to get into the room to dress for the wedding. The lobby was very cozy and had free coffee, tea and big screen TV a great place to talk with family and friends.  The night shift front desk (Mariposa) was extremely friendly.  The
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review, and congratulations to your daughter! We're happy to have been part of this special day, and we appreciate your recommendation - thank you!

Summary: I've stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites in San Clemente many times before on business trips and have always looked forward to coming back. My most recent trip, in June 2012 was as always, exceptional. When I checked in, Rosalind made me feel like I was their most important guest. She took very good care of me. My room was ready when I arrived, and was clean and comfortable, as always. The free hi-speed internet is easy to connect to and works very well. The climate control kept the room just the way I like it - cold! I love the Hampton Inn breakfast every morning. I went down to the front desk several times to get ice cream, and Andrea was there to help me. Andrea is so pretty and her bright and cheerful personality made me want to visit the front desk every day, just to say
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! I'll be sure to forward this to Andrea, she will love to read it. We are looking forward to welcome you again later this year!

Summary: Really enjoyed the stay at this place. Very nice accomadations and the staff was super friendly. They helped with local information and what they didnt know they searched the internet and sent me an email later that day. There are also great beaches nearby. Small town, quaint and a pretty good restaurant close by called The Fisherman. The hotel staff also found a article of clothing I had left behind and they said they would ship it Fedex to my house and just add any shipping charges to the same card I used for the room. I suppose the best thing I liked about the staff was that their friendliness was genuine. Would gladly stay there again.
Manager Response: A genuine 'thank you' for this wonderful review.

Summary: Thanks so much to the Rosalind, Andrea, Mariposa and the rest of the staff for a delightful weeklong stay in San Clemente. The entrie staff was always smiling and friendly and really made our stay there exceptional.  My son and I rented surfboards and Andrea was so helpful in finding a place to store them and helping even when we needed to borrow a screwdriver to tighten a fin one morning.  The room was comfortable and a very good value.  The dealmaker by far was the exceptional value provided by not having to pay for parking, internet or breakfast each day....this made the difference in our being able to afford a vacation in SoCal.  PLEASE, never change that policy. Thanks again and not only will we return again but i will definitely tell all of our friends about it as well.
Manager Response: Hi Jeff.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, your recommendation is greatly appreciated! I'll be sure to forward your comments to the staff, they'lll love to read them. Thanks again, and we're looking forward to welcome you again inthe future!  Your team from the Hampton Inn San Clemente

Summary: We have stayed here several times before. Son used our Hilton honors points twice this month.  We came for our 40th anniversary. I had asked for wine , champagne , soda , something to surprise husband, they told me it would happen, however when we arrived , room wasn't ready, waited almost an hour.  Anniversary came and went with nothing as promised. ( note had been made with reservation).  Manager said was out of her control?  Poor customer service.  Breakfast, no room to sit, was told they overbooked, lounge furniture falling apart, safety issue.  Very disappointed, customer service really needs addressed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed 1 night traveling from Anaheim (Disneyland) to San Diego. Having spent the day at Disneyland, we called the hotel front desk to inform them we would not arrive by 6pm and the person said it's no problem. We arrived close to midnight. He was welcoming and greeted us when we entered the door. When we said our last name, he was like Ohhh Welcome! The room was clean. The beds were comfortable. The following morning, the breakfast area wasn't crowded and the food was decent -- I made my waffles .. delicious. If you look outside, you may catch people playing golf a short viewing distance. There was some evidence of construction occurring, but no one was doing construction work the morning that I was there. Good! Check out was easy. Friendly staff. I would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review! We hope to welcome you again the next time you are in the area.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in July.  The hotel was clean and comfortable, and the complementary breakfast included a great variety of foods from a full cooked breakfast to yogurts and bagels, lots of juice and great coffee.  Our room was quiet and overlooked the golf course.  The hotel staff were pleasant, friendly, courteous and efficient and were always willing to be helpful.  Everyone associated with the hotel seemed to be very happy, which is a compliment to the management.  The front desk staff were great and gave us a good room at a very reasonable rate.  It is very close to the beach and other attractions. We will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to all our friends who wanted to stay in San Clemente.
Manager Response: Thank you! Your recommendation is greatly appreciated.

Summary Heading: Needs major upgrades and more cleanliness in pool area
Summary: Stayed here over weekend and was very disappointed for $200 First asked for quiet room(we have a 3 year old )with a view of ocean no view and got room on bottom next to the 5 freeway and under a wedding party that made noise all night Awesome !!!!! And no they had other room to find out . We called two times about the noise last call being at 1 am and front desk guy said well its people coming back from wedding party and he was not going to tell them to stop partying-wow - asked if we wanted to fleep in a room that was much quiter but by the time he called back at 2 am  said with three year old no thanks and before this when we got to spa/pool both were filthy scummy and sandy I mean like duty foam moutauns the front desk said they will clean spa and do sorry but then we went in
Manager Response: I have to apologize for your recent experience at our hotel. There is certainly no excuse for the lapse in service you received. We will review this incident to ensure that these issues in guest service and maintenance won't occur again in the future. Again, my sincere apologies, and I do hope you will reconsider staying with us again in the future for an experience more in line with the great service our guests have come to expect from us.

Summary: hotel was an awesome oceanview and great breakfast options and they even have a manager's reception on wednesday afternoon. You get a complimentart wine and beer and snacks. Front desk staff are faboulous. I will definately stay at these property again.
Manager Response: Thank you!

Summary: Although it is a short drive to main part of San Clemente which was very nice.  The hotel is dated and rooms were not what I expected from a Hampton Inn.  They may have rooms with ocean views but you will have Interstate 5 to look over to see it in the horizon.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I spent a Saturday evening in May here while attending the Doheny Blues Festival. Friendly check in. Clean, well cared for room. Quiet room even though the hotel is near the freeway - no noticeable noise from outside, other rooms, or hallway. Thanks for a pleasant stay. Would stay again if in the area.
Manager Response: Thank YOU for this wonderful review! Hope you had a great time at the Blues Festival.

Summary Heading: Very nice, close to the beach.
Summary: Very clean newer hotel. Our room was very spacious with a big balcony. Service was amazing!  We called down for an extra blanket and there was a knock on the door within 2 minutes. Breakfast was typically Hampton but the ladies kept fresh food coming out consistently and they kept the dining room impeccably clean.   Great location. Literally a two minute drive to the state beach which is really nice. This was a work trip, but I'm looking at coming back with just my family.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience! We are looking forward to welcome you and your family in the future.

Summary: I arrived at this Hampton Inn Jan.15, for a supposed 3 week business trip.  118 days later, I checked out!!  The hotel staff is without question the friendliest I've ever encountered.   Everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping staff knew me by name as I became a resident of San Clemente. kkkkkkkk  My family flew out for a visit and stayed here as well.  We were all treated good as gold.  Each evening when I returned to my room from work, it had been cleaned as if I had just checked in.  The pool and jacuzzi out back are a great place to relax and unwind under the stars in the evenings.  For the early risers, the breakfast room opens at 6am every day, with a good variety of items to start the day, and I never saw the hostess, Luisa without a smile on her face.  I will
Manager Response: Hi Kevin!   This year's outage really was something else, wasn't it? Glad to hear that we were able to make your stay a pleasant one for you and your family, and we are looking forward to welcome you again the next time duty calls!  Greetings, your team from the Hampton Inn San Clemente!

Summary: Travelled to San Clemente on a business trip.  Hotel is nicely located.  Room was facing the Interstate noise was abundant but after a while you get used to it.  Breakfast service was excellent and Luisa who worked  there had excellent customer service skills.  Room was average but very clean, phone next to the bed did not work but I never call  anyone to get it fixed.  Overall was a pleasant stay, frontdesk staff housekeeping staff were friendly and customer focused.  I will most definetely stay here again in the future.  Efrain
Manager Response: Thank you for this kind review, we are glad you enjoyed your stay! I apologize about the phone - please feel free to email me your room number at sandrag[at]dknhotels[dot]com so I can make sure that we had it fixed.

Summary: The wife and I traveled to San Clemente and stayed overnight so we could be closer to the whale watching event in Dana Point.  When we arrived to the hotel, we were warmly greeted and quickly registered. We immediately noticed that the staff was determined to make this a good experience for us.   The room was clean, nice (or neutral) in smell, and we had no problems with any of the amenities. It is apparent that the staff maintains the rooms just like you want them to. The pool and hot tub was nice to use- all good selling points.  There was a full breakfast with everything I wanted to eat and more. It was your won fault if you went away hungry!   The hotel also hosts an early evening mixer in which they served drinks and nachos in their lobby. The manager Rosalind kept the
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! We have forwarded it to Rosalind and recognized her for a job well done!

Summary Heading: Local needed to stay due to home tenting
Summary: My wife and I needed a place to stay during a termite tenting at our house. Thought about staying at the Double tree in Dana Point, but after the add - ons at the Double Tree (parking $22, Wifi $15 etc) we decide this might be the better value. We were on the view side, and it is noisy, but not to bad if you have the window/door closed. (we live near the freeway, so we are more imune). If you need quiet, ask to be on the golf course side. Staff was very helpfull and friendly. The room was small, but my wife was able to work at the desk. Bed was comfy, room was clean. This is away from the "action" in San Clemente. You can actually walk to quite a bit of stuff, but most of it will be more than 15minutes. I would stay there again if the need arises.
Manager Response: Oh, termite tentings are such a pain in the neck... we are glad we were able to provide a pleasant stay while you had to be away from your home, and hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: We had originally reserved three nights due to our entire house being carpeted and absolutely nowhere to sleep or cook meals or get to any additinal clothing.  Long story short... Our carpet didn't arrive at the warehouse so they couldn't install the carpeting.  Due to that snafu we asked the daytime manager Rosalind if she could please cancel two days due to our situation. She didn't hesitate, was very helpful and based on that we are going to book three more days with that hotle.  The room was exceptional, clean, spacious and we look forward to staying there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience! We will certainly recognize Rosalind for a job well done.

Summary: The friendly service and recommendations from the front desk were outstanding.  Great restaurants with in walking distance.   Parking was free and fantastic.  Community and beaches outstanding. Made for a perfect weekend.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review. Glad to hear you had a fantastic weekend!

Summary: The front desk staff was always kind and helpful!  The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good. It's a great location and felt very comfortable and welcome. Thanks!!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience! We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: Front desk staff was pleasant and helpful.  Room was clean and well maintained.  Breakfast was plentiful and good.  The cook / server was observant and kept the area well stocked and clean.  Guest laundry was clean and the prices were a steal, $1 per machine!  We will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you! We are looking forward to welcome you again!

Summary: One of the best Hampton's I have ever stayed in.  The staff, especially Rosalind, are awesome. I was there for work but brought my kids.  They were able to walk to the beach each day, while I enjoyed being in the middle of SD and LA for work. I will stay here again and again.
Manager Response: Thank you! We are happy to hear that you and your kids had a great time, and yes, Rosalind IS awesome! We are looking forward to see you again the next time you are in the area!

Summary Heading: Excellent Staff One of the best hampton staffs.
Summary: I also stay in hotels quite a bit and all the hotels in San Clemente are older hotels and you can not compare to new facilities and most are by the interstate. I stayed in one of the other chains in the area for a short time and this hotel although dated is way better. They are planning a remodel shortly and and will be upgrading the rooms. I have been here for multiple weeks and had several of the rooms and have spent the most on the Ocean side and yes if you leave window open you will have lots of noise from the Interstate. Most of the suites have the bedroom to the interior so sleeping is not a problem from the noise.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: OK Room, Needs Updating...But Excellent Staff!
Summary: Let me start by saying I'm not your average hotel guest, I spend 200-250 nights a year in a hotel and have some expectations and pet peeves some other guest may not have, none the less, I provide an unbiased honest review both good and bad.  I had a room on the top floor in the corner with I guess what would be considered a balcony. Great view overlooking the ocean, even though it's probably about a half mile away it was still a great view of the water and sunset. The room itself is dated and needs updating. I travel for business and get annoyed when I have to move furniture to find a plug for a cell phone charger, a place to plug my laptop in, etc. For those who regularly travel on business you know what I mean. The room looked very clean, however, I couldn't ignore the strong
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great place for the price
Summary: I've been working in the San Clemente area and needed to make a few over night trips, so I've been "hotel shopping".  I stayed at another "Inn", it was fine but for less price I got a hot breakfast at Hampton.  I stayed at Hampton last week and will return this coming week.  What an added bonus to have a living room with a sleeper couch.  While I didn't need it, its nice to have 2 separate sleeping areas.  The hot breakfast is a nice touch, nothing fancy but I wouldn't expect it for the price. if you can't stay for breakfast, they even have breakfast to go.  The bed is comfortable but the furniture is a little dated.. well so what!, its fine and well maintained.  The place is very clean and staff was very professional.  I just called to make sure I was on the golf course side of
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are looking forward to see you again!

Summary: We stayed for v-day and it was great! The front desk staff, Maureen, was wonderful. So welcoming and accomidating. She was friendly and helpful. Such a good energy. Our initial room was smaller than we had anticipated, so we called down to see if we could get a different room, it was no problem at all. After our change, she called our room to make sure everything was ok. I would definelty recommend, if your in the area, to stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review and the recommendation, it is much appreciated.

Summary: Very friendly staff, made us feel like family.  This was our second stay in a year and we will return.  The room was very clean, always fresh towels and bedding.  The morning breakfast was fantastic!  Walking distance to beach and golf.
Manager Response: Thank you! We are looking forward to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: Professional, Helpfull and Friendly Staff, Close to amenities, beaches,golfing and downtown, Spacious clean rooms, Good breakfast. I'll stay here again when I am in the area. I was there for work and they even accomodated my working nights by cleaning my room while I was away at work "NOW THAT'S SERVICE". My departure date changed several times and they gladly accomodated me by extending my room stay to fit my needs. Thank to All
Manager Response: Now that's a review! :-) Thank you!

Summary: The hotel is just a short walk from the gorgeous beaches of San Clemente as well as many  other attractions. The hotel "visitor's center" provided some great information on local activities, including the beautiful Casa Romantica, which is a must-see for anyone visiting San Clemente. The hotel staff made our stay very enjoyable and were extremely friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review!

Summary: I was really impressed with the service. The staff at the hotel was top notch! They made me feel like I was important. Everything I asked for was provided and more. They did things for me that I didn't even expect! Super friendly people. The manager even came out and chatted with me a bit. I told the tall blond girl at the front desk I had a headache and she told me where I could get some Tylonal too! Breakfast is included and I saw free cookies at the front desk too! While the furnishings are dated, the cost is completely reasonable for all you get here. This is not guaranteed, but I even got an ocean view! I'm not sure what else is in the area, but for what you pay, this is a good option.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! We hope the headache cleared up quickly and you were able to enjoy beautiful San Clemente.

Summary: This hotel is an older hotel but very well maintained. Rooms are very nice with an ocean view on the west side, golf course on the east. Staff of the hotel is helpful and very accomodating. Will stay here anytime I'm in San Clemente. There are several restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Plan to bring my wife here for a couples weekend.
Manager Response: Thank you for this review. We are looking forward to welcome you and your wife on your couple's weekend!

Summary: Our stay there was great ! Front desk was so helpful! The elevators do take a long time.
Manager Response: Thank you! Glad you enjoyed the stay, despite the slow elevators (we will have a look at that!).

Summary: The location of this hotel is great - takes just a few minutes to drive downtown, and very close to several beautiful beaches.  Our room was quite spacious, and had a bedroom with a door that divided it from the sitting area.  Comfortable and clean.  The only complaint about the room was that it was a little too noisy for us.  Our room faced the street and the traffic noise could be heard most of the time.  When we arrived, were happy to see a balcony door, hoping to keep it open a bit to take in a little more fresh, ocean air.  That wasn't a possibility due to the noise from the traffic.  Quiet otherwise.  Breakfast was good, as we usually find at a Hampton Inn, and always pleased to have it conveniently available every morning, and included.  Parking wasn't a problem for us,
Manager Response: Thank you! We are happy that you enjoyed your stay, and appreciate the recommendation.

Summary: This is the number one reason why we have stayed there twice. Plus it's an easy drive down from John Wayne Airport. No matter what time of day. I actually found it easier to see the exit in the dark!  The hotel is an excellent value for money. The breakfast buffet is SUPER. I get to try things there that I normally wouldn't bother with at home.  The rooms are spacious. We can watch different TV shows without interruption. The bathroom really functional.  We are going to buy the loopless shower curtain and the curved rail.  There is nothing worse than wearing a wet shower curtain! The little balcony is enough to sit out and enjoy the sunrise.  This will be our annual destination for Christmas's to come. Highly rated for those who have military family at the North end of Camp
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review. We're looking forward to see you again the next time you visit Camp Pendleton!

Summary: I have stayed with this facility a couple of times per year over the past several years. Service, facilities, ammenities, staff, and location are very nice. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Probably one of the better breakfast presentations I've seen during my travels. I also stay at Hampton Inns during my leisure travels. I recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was literally a breath of fresh air.  Very clean and well run.  Rooms are large with two separate areas.  Bed was comfortable.  Staff was well trained and courteous.  Very "can do".  Location was quiet and convenient.  This hotel is definitely an upgrade and worth the extra cost.  They even had popcorn in the room which was a welcome touch.  Free breakfast which we missed.  I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! We are glad you enjoyed your stay, and we hope to be able to welcome you back again soon!

Summary Heading: Hampton Inn in San Clemente, CA  -  What a Great Experience !
Summary: I do a great deal of travel for work and I stay exclusively at the Hilton family of hotels, many time Hampton Inns. Most hotels within any chain are passable with very few rising above indifferent service. In my opinion, the Hampton Inn in San Clemente is exceptional. The management, beginning with Rosalind Batterton and all the staff could not be more welcoming and helpful. It is clear to me that they do all  they can to create a pleasant experience for their guests. In fact, I genuinely feel like a “guest” when I stay with them. I can tell that they view each interaction through the guest’s eyes. From how they deal with the parking of cars, to an afternoon Manager’s Reception (which I have not seen at any other Hampton Inn), to how they deal with special requests, it was a joy
Manager Response: Wow, thank you for this wonderful review, Carmen! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and hope to be able to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely, your team from the Hampton Inn & Suites San Clemente

Summary: We were relocating to San Clemente from LA with the military and this was the perfect place.  The beds were comfy, separate living area, nice pool, decent choices for breakfast.  Awesome location.  Staff was great.  Only thing that was a little tricky at times was the parking (no fee, just space limited).
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this great review, and welcome to San Clemente!

Summary Heading: Not up to the standard of other Hampton Inns
Summary: The main problem I had with this hotel was that when I reserved the room, it was stated that there was a sofa bed in the sitting/TV area.  When I arrived, there was only 2 small side chairs-it looked like the sofa had been removed with awkward open space in the room.  One reason I like to go to Hampton Inn is that it is so flexible when I travel with my kids and when you take away the sofa bed, all flexibility is lost.  I never asked the front desk to change my room because I checked in late and everyone was so tired and we weren't staying for very long-I didn't want to move everyone and all the stuff.  I don't know if they would have accomodated me or not.  For all other matters, the serrvice was excellent.  The room was clean, but the furnishings felt a little tired.  Other
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Staff is rude.  Hotel is noisy and worn.
Summary: We were told that we would have a quiet suite  away from the interstate, ice machine, elevator and pool.  We were assured after many phone calls to the hotel. that we would have a quiet room. When we arrived the rooms we were shown were either NOT a suite or were noisy next to the interstate etc. Or another suite had the bedroom when you walked into the room and the living room behind it.  Very strange! The staff was not honest with us on the phone when we booked weeks in advance.  There were kids running around the hallways and people carrying a case of beer to their room.  We left this hotel and found a QUIET, CLEAN hotel nearby.  Hilton customer service was not interested in our experience.  This hotel's GM Hirem [--] never offered an apology.  Apparently there are enough
Manager Response: After reading your comments in regards to your stay at our hotel, I want to personally apologize for the inconvenience you had encountered at our hotel. We strive to make every guest happy and make sure that their stay is comfortable. We realize that we have failed to do so with you and your stay. Again I want to sincerely apologize for that. Please be assured that we will be advising our staff and making sure that they provide the best knowledge of the hotel and the surrounding areas. We will also monitor closely the possible disturbance caused by other guests after quite hours. Unfortunately our hotel stands between the freeway and the golf course and the 2 room suites are either facing the freeway (oceanview) or the golf course side (poolview). To minimise the noise from the freeway we have put double paned windows and doors to our balconies. I am sorry that even after that the noise from the freeway was a distraction.  Please again accept my sincere apologies and if you have any questions please feel free to contact me at the hotel.   Thank you,  Hiren Patel  General Manager.

Summary: On vacation a nice hotel makes or breaks the trip for me.  Not worth the money spent on this room which was RIGHT next to the expressway (yes, you could hear it all night if you are a light sleeper); annoying a/c fan over bath hallway so we had to keep the door closed to the sleeping / bedroom.  Old tired furniture in LR portion.  Sort of smelled musty and I wouldn't walk around with bare feet.  It had a new TV and a new bed, but everything else was dated and old.  For same or a few dollars more go to downtown San Clemente at the pier and get a local hotel as this chain did not offer much.  Many around the pier had vacancy.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My favorite place to stay in the area
Summary: I am a frequent visitor to this hotel.  The staff is super friendly and helpful in all ways.  Breakfast works for me and the rooms are always clean.  Beds are very comfortable.  Fast and easy access to I-5.  I will always come back when I am in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our hotel! It is always a pleasure to hear that our guests enjoyed their stay, and that we are becoming their little 'home away from home' whenever they are in the area.  Thank you again for the recommendation, and we hope to be able to welcome you back again soon.  Greetings,  your team from the Hampton Inn & Suites San Clemente

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel, clean room, great breakfast, employees helpful!
Summary: We went to CA to visit my brother and his family. They lived right down the street and the location of this hotel was fabulous for us. You could get onHighway 5 in a minute, and you could get to the beach in a few minutes.  Our room was spacious and clean.  Had no problems with anything while we were there!  The breakfast was so wonderful, and the food was delicious and convenient.  It was so nice to get up and just walk down the hall for food and coffee.  Not to mention the queen size beds were so comfortable. Where else can you get a queen size bed without paying a ton of money???  We even used the pool and the kids loved it to cool off for a little while.  I can't say enough good things about the hotel. The employees were helpful and kind. And San Clemente is such a wonderful
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this wonderful review! It is great to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel, and we are looking forward to welcoming you again in the future. I'll be sure to forward your comments to our staff, as they always strive to create the best possible vacation experience for our guests, and they will enjoy reading how their hard work pays off.  Greetings, your team from the Hampton Inn & Suites San Clemente.

Summary: I was in San Clemente for a week for business at the San Onofre Nuclear Generating Station nearby. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, the room was spacious and looked out over the ocean. The only downside was that the hotel is right on I-5, so if you have your balcony door open, it's very loud. With the door closed, however, it wasn't bad. I will likely stay at this hotel again in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, your comments are very much appreciated. We hope to welcome you again the next time you have to do business in the area, as you really can't beat our proximity to San Onofre. While the oceanview is definitely a perk of our westward facing rooms, our rooms facing the lovely San Clemente municipal golf course offer the same comfort in a more quiet environment, away from the street.  Greetings, your team from the Hampton Inn & Suites San Clemente

Summary: All the staff members, each & everyone (      I.e. from the front desk, the individuals helping me with my luggage, cleaning staff, & maintenance) were always very friendly, respectful, understanding, & helpful! The people at the front desk were responsive & accomodating! I had a couple of maintenance issues, such as a a light not working & my refridgerator not staying as cool as needed. Staff quickly resolved the issues! The maintence staff was fast to respond! The hotel is generally very quite. I feel very safe here. The rooms are kept clean & neat.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, we very much appreciate your comments. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and we'll be sure to recognize our team members for a job well done.  We hope to be able to welcome you back again soon.   Greetings, your team from the Hampton Inn & Suites San Clemente.

Summary: We found this hotel @ 11:30 at night by chance, they were very accommodating and the price was great for what was included. Most hotels will charge you for parking, internet access & breakfast and at this spot everything was included in the rate.  The hotel was very clean and the breakfast was great. I highly recommend this great little hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this wonderful review, we always love to hear from our guests! We sure are happy that you found our hotel at 11:30 in the night, and are glad that you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to welcome you again soon, and appreciate your recommendations.  Greetings, your team from the Hampton Inn & Suites San Clemente!

Summary: We got to the coast much later than expected and had resigned ourselves to being lucky to find a clean room.  Almost drove by, because I have used Hampton's before and thought they were overpriced for what you got.  This has changed my mind, great customer service, clean room with lots of space and a very comfortable bed. Pleasant  breakfast also.  We talked about laying over for a day just because it was such a refreshing travel experience.  Only drawback was parking somewhat limited.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Rooms - Hampton Inn and Suites San Clemente
Summary: I stayed here for a week during a business trip and enjoyed the hotel. It was a bit of a walk from reasonable restaurants, but convenient to the I-5 freeway (there was some road noise at night, so you might want a room NOT facing the freeway). Rooms were nice, breakfast well stocked, and help was very friendly. Very enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, but weird room set up.
Summary: Our room was nice and clean, but it had a very weird set up. What would normally be the entry/living room was the bedroom, and the fold out couch was in the back section of the room with its own door.  Therefore, we were right next to the door and the hallway while we slept and could hear every person walking through and talking.  The bed also made a loud metallic clanging when we sat down on it.  The location was fine though for the family wedding we attended at Casa Romantica and breakfast was okay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms were spacious with a nice sitting area. The extra room is a great feature. Hotel is older but they keep it clean. Parking garage was dirty and flooded which ruined our shoes for vacation breakfast is the average waffles, Danishes, eggs and yogurt ect.  Pool is small. Great beach very close. A car would be best. Taco bell, starbucks, Kfc, carls jr and ralphs grocery store are all close enough. Queen suites are on highway/ocean  side and double suites on golf  coiurse side. This hotel is excellent if you need space for your son that is on liberty from camp pendleton. Like a mini house and within 5 min from SOI.  I will stay here again for this reason for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff is exeptionally friendly! Free breakfast had a little bit of everything for our family, which was wonderful. About a ten minute walk to the beach, but with the beautiful weather we didn't mind it one minute. Restaurants are very near. I do have to say that their beds are extremely comfortable and the maids do a wonderful job. We will definately stay here again when we are in San Clemente.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The good:  friendly staff; convenient location in an adorable town; suite sized rooms; price.  The bad: crowded breakfast area with sub-par Hampton breakfast; unappealing pool; room could've been cleaner.  The area: lots of cute places in/around town to grab a quick breakfast (Bagel Shack) or have a leisurly dinner.  Drove over the highway to the park where we could put a few quarters in the meeter and then take relaxing morning walks along the ocean path.  Would visit the town again, but would give a different hotel a try.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Disappointing.  Tired and expensive Hampton Inn
Summary: We like Hampton Inns because they are usually good value for money.  This wasn't really.  Very tired and in need of updating.  Musty smell throughout and in the breakfast room especially.  We paid about 90 quid, which seemed expensive for the standard of the hotel.  The beds were comfy and the room was clean, plus we overlooked the golf course, so it was fairly quiet.  Not all bad, just in need of a good makeover.  Would suggest looking at Laguna Beach hotels instead, which is not that far away.  Not much in San Clemente but we only used it as a stop over en route to San Diego. If we'd known, we'd probably have gone a few miles further to Carlsbad - the Hampton Inn there is very good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here over the fourth of July weekend. We had a 3rd floor jacuzzi room that was very clean and spacious. The front desk called when we got to the room, to make sure everything was fine with us. The balcony overlooked the golf course and was very relaxing to watch. The bed and bedding was extremely comfortable. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and beer (one night) the hotel offered. We ate at several of the local eateries and were quite impressed. Underground parking made us feel safe with our classic car. A great hotel, great staff and we will be back next year!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value for the Price......good beds, free breakfast, great staff!!
Summary: Stayed at this Hampton Inn for two nights. Rooms on both side of the hotel have their advantages.  Off the west side, thought close to the interstate, you can watch the sunsets.  Off the east side you overlook a very peaceful golf course and pool area. The suites are lovely.  Room  appeared clean with updated beds and bedding.  Patio with chair and table. Desk area in bedroom.  Living room has good seating, microwave and refrigerator. I had free breakfast and newspaper in the morning right next to the pool, inside or outside seating....in the evening I had cocktails, hot snacks and cookies.....really can't be beat for the price. Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Free parking either underground or outside. I had a problem with booking both nights (my mistake) and the staff
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was great, very helpful and friendly.  Had a problem with the DVD player in our room and the girl at the front desk was extremly helpful in getting us some help.  The room was plenty big for 4 adults (we had the 2 queen suite).  Room and bathroom were clean and the beds were very soft and comfortable with plenty on pillows.  When asked if we could get a couple of extra towels for the pool we were given 4 unlike some hotels that barly want to give you enough to shower with.  We were surprised at how soft the towels were compared to the usuall sandpaper feeling ones.  The only negective is it is not walking distance to the beach.  We had taken the Metrolink train from home so we had the take a bus to the beach but the weather was nice and it only took us about 15mins to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A car is an absolute must
Summary: I have been coming to this hotel consistently for past 12 years, about 20-30 nights every year.  The location is not the greatest unless you are willing to drive to get anywhere, which is the only acceptable mode of transportation in Southern California anyhow…  The hotel itself, however, is great: the rooms are large, clean and comfortable.  Free WiFi, free warm breakfast, friendly and accommodating staff.  Best of all – you are a short drive from the best surf in California. Strongly recommended for families who want to stay in the same unit with the kids, but not in the same room (since the bedroom is separated from the living room by a door).  This recommendation is especially applicable if the family wants to go out and surf all day.  Not recommended for people whose idea
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great spot to spend a few days
Summary: We love staying in this particular Hampton Inn because it is directly adjacent to the San Clemente Municipal Golf Course.  The one bedroom suite for $129 was a great deal; large sitting room plus the two beds and a nice bathroom.  The free breakfast each morning is a real plus and coffee, tea, and hot chocolate are available all day long in the lobby.  There is no actual restaurant adjacent but the golf course has a nice looking place to eat called "Irons in the Fire" serving food all day.  For those who are unfamiliar with San Clemente, it is roughly half way between Los Angeles and San Diego.  The sites to see are the beach, quaint shops and restaurants, and the major tourist attractions of LA and San Diego areas.  The golf course is very challenging and not too expensive

Summary: We booked a room at a hotel down the street, the Best Western Casablanca Inn for two nights. When I showed up to that place it was a complete dump! I walked into the room and it was horrible. I immidiately walked back down to the front desk and fought with them to get my money back. You can find that story on the reviews for that hotel.   Our friends told us to come stay at the Hampton Inn. It was great. About $40 a night cheaper than the other dump and it was so much nicer. Very friendly staff, clean comfortable suites with a living room and bedroom, refridgerator, microwave, and two tv's. Summary: A really good hotel if you are travelling through this area. It is not near the beach but is situated between the Rt101 and on El Camino Real. However I woud definately stay here again. Top marks go to the girls on reception who went out of their way to help us find a luggage trolley and were extremely helpful and welcoming.  We had a room at the back of the hotel overlooking the golf course and the pool. It had it's own little balcony where it was pleasant to sit out in the evening. It was clean and the beds comfortable. The sitting area was large and comfortable. The staff invited us to a complementary BBQ round the pool at 6.30, but it was not rowdy or noisy despite the number of young people.  Parking is underneath the hotel which ensures that there is easy access and also
Manager Response: none

Summary: I love this hotel!!  My husband, 3 year-old-son and I just finished a weekend in San Clemente at this hotel and it was perfect.  First, the price is fantastic, at approximately $130 per night for a two-room suite.  Second, it is a real two-room suite.  I did a lot of on-line research and it seems that many other hotels either cut a regular size room in half or simply separate the bed and living areas in some way.  This suite, however, had a real door with a window and a sheer curtain between the two rooms.  For us this was mandatory, because my husband and I did not want to have to go to bed at 8:00 p.m. with our son.  We did hang a beach towel on the door to cut down on the light then went from our room into our son’s room, but I think that was out of an abundance of caution

Summary: This was a different kind of hotel than what I am used to staying in. It was more than a place to spend the night in and it felt like a home away from home. Staff was friendly and always had a smile on their face which made it comfortable for my shy self to ask questions about the area and inquire what there is to do in the area. I would gladly book this hotel again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to use as "home base" while visiting CA coastal areas. Only 1.25 hrs from Disney, easy access to Newport, Huntington, Laguna Beaches and piers. While not right on the beach, is within walking distance, however is not an easy walk... definately worth a visit, however, as was a beautiful park and could easily walk down to the pier. (PS: you need coins for all parking along the Pacific Coast Highway and beach parks!)  Rooms at the back of the hotel overlook a lovely golf course. Front of the hotel rooms overlook the expressway, but thick windows prevent noise and  the views of the Pacific Ocean and the sunsets from our room were magnificent!   Staff was friendly and quite helpful in everything - upon arrival at 6:55 PM Thursday nite were told to hurry up to breakfast
Manager Response: none

Summary: Lots of room in our two bedroom suite with living room. Two TVs, a fridge, and a microwave. Nice features with two teenagers. Cost was only about $130 with a AAA membership. Breakfast was ample. We didn't notice the freeway noise. We were just passing through on our way south, so was a great stop.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a clean, comfortable room. The breakfast had many choices and was filling. I found nothing to complain about. My wife and I stayed here on a Thursday night for $130.90. We upgraded to a king suite and it was worth it. The thermostat was digital so you knew exactly how to set the temperature. This was our sixth stop on a trip down Pacific Coast Highway CA1 from Oakland to San Diego. Next stop was SAN airport and back home.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Old property in need of refresh
Summary: I just stayed for three days in a whirlpool suite. It was 'ok'. Seemed worn and tattered to be honest. 1st floor smelled of milldew when going to breakfast. Air conditioning in room was louder than a 747. Elevator lights were burnt out, and the business center was flooded and the carpet smelled of milldew. The room was clean, but old. Good if you need to be close to I-5...and like others have said...only Hiltion property for miles. I don't think I'll be returning.

Summary: This place was awesome! All the positive reviews were totally true! The room was spotless and stunning. At first I was a bit hesitant about a room by the freeway but it was not a problem at all. You barely could hear it, considering you were literally right on top of it. The staff was friendly and easy also. Overall, an excellent experience. A+!!!

Summary: Just as you might choose to eat at a chain restaurant in an unfamiliar town - because you know what to expect - I chose this Hampton Inn (online) over no-name competitors. (I chose San Clemente because we wanted to do day trips to L.A. and San Diego.)  My family and I just finished a week-long stay at this hotel and we generally liked the place. I did some research before booking, including a Google aerial view, so I had a sense of the property and its surrounding area. Knowing that, when we arrived I asked the clerk which side of the hotel would be best - the golf course side which gets the morning sun or the ocean (and interstate) side which gets the setting sun. She suggested the golf side and I'm glad she did - the interstate traffic noise is incessant, punctuated by truck

Summary Heading: GREAT location between San Diego and LA!
Summary: Our family (myself, husband and 10 yr old son) have stayed at this hotel for a week at a time for the past 3 summers.  Although is is not fancy it is very functional, clean, friendly,reliable and the beds are comfortable!  It has a very nice pool/spa area and since its a relatively small hotel one is not overwhelmed by a bunch of loud unsupervised kids using the pool!  Too bad there's not more of a variety in their breakfast offerings but one can certainly get full on the breakfast.  The hotel also has a washer/dryer for hotel guests which I've ended up using on every vacation!  This hotel is very conveniently located off I-5 and it is easily accessable to most of Orange County and it is right in between LA and San Diego.  The traffic to San Diego is terrible so we focus on the
Manager Response: none

Summary: The suite was not really that great.. As mentioned before from other reviewers, the ocean front view leaves much to be desired.  Between you and the beach are a four lane road and the Interstate 5 freeway., about 8 blocks more and over the railroad tracks and your there. You are not really a leisurely strolll to the beach. It is quite aways away. You need to drive. All of the action in San Clemente is on Del Mar Ave. You are not even close to there. The hot breakfast was not really that good.  Flat sausage patties and french toast sticks one day, and flat sausage patties and flat scrambled egg patties the next. Along with all of the other usual continental breakfast fare, it was just OK. The mid week poolside BBQ was a joke. A guy grilling hot dogs and hamburgers by the pool.

Summary: I had planned an anniversary weekend getaway from LA to the nice town of San Clemente.  Upon checking in to the hotel, we were greeted by the girl at the front desk who was very pleasant.  She explained everything we needed to know about the hotel.  They have a business center in the lobby with FAX, computers, scanner and phones.  They also offer free WI-FI throughout the property. The room was nicely decorated with a good sized refrigerator, microwave, blow dryer, iron and 2 TV's, 1 in the room and the other in the living room with a sofa, 2 chairs and a desk.  Our room had a view to the ocean which was nice to wake up to.  The breakfast was better than most hotels that offer continental breakfast.  Items included: sausage, french toast sticks, danish, muffins, bagels, toast,

Summary Heading: The place to stay in San Clemente
Summary: We stayed two nights in the Hampton Inn and Suites in mid-January 2007 and were able to get a jacuzzi suite on a walk-in basis for the same price we had just stayed at a much smaller room near downtown Los Angeles. The desk clerk showed us the suite before we committed, and was super-helpful. The staff at this inn was always able to meet whatever request we had.  Breakfast, included in the room rate, was somewhat above average for hotels, but nothing to write home about. The quality and size of the room were fine. The location was fine. The service was fine.  After we checked out we realized we had left a cellphone in the room. We called and the desk clerk tracked down the head housekeeper, who had spotted it and set it aside knowing its owner would show up for it. We were
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites for 3 nights in November and the room was beautiful.  We had a lovely jacuzzi suite and it couldn't have been better.  The staff was friendly and very accomodating.  Thanks for a great stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Saved our Trip of a Lifetime!
Summary: After finding our room at another resort to be terrible we arrived at the Hampton Inn and Suites in San Clemente, California.  Upon arrival I spoke to William at the front desk and told him what had just happened to us and that we needed a room for 4 women where we could stay for 5 days . One of the people was very ill and required much rest.  We were given a beautiful suite,, with exceptional care from all the staff and it even included a parking garage and breakfast!  We found our stay wonderful at this hotel and the staff incredible in helping us to enjoy our visit while caring for a family member who is quite ill.  I can not say enough about the Hampton Inn and Suites as they saved our once in a lifetime trip with our mother by giving us a wonderful place to stay after we

Summary Heading: What a wonderful place to stay!
Summary: We ended up at the Hampton Inn with no reservations after leaving another hotel we had booked because it was so filthy. The Personnel at the Hampton Inn provided a room for the  four of us, my sisters and very ill mother (who we had brought to California to see the ocean),  for a full five days, accomadating us with a wonderful suite, with excellent service, free breakfasts, the internet, cable, and room service. They turned what had looked like a nightmare trip into a wonderful vacation for us to enjoy the climate and beauty of San Clemente and spend quality time with our mother, instead of driving from hotel to hotel our entire trip. Thank You Hampton Inn-you have wonderful, caring personnel who made our trip a true vacation!

Summary: Our King Suite was fabulous.  2 good size rooms with an ocean view.  Top shelf all the way.  Bath goodies included  mouth wash, QTIPS and cotton balls......the room had 2 TV's, a fridge, microwave & 2 sinks, a sofa, chair & a desk.  It was up to date & in great condition.  Hot B'fast bar has something for everyone.  This hotel is bargain for the area.  Convient to run up coast for the day or just hang around the town.  The staff is all super nice!!!!

Summary Heading: Great place to take the kids & see the local sites
Summary: We had the pleasure of staying in a double-queen suite with an ocean view, 3rd floor. All the amenities mentioned by the other reviewers are true, but they also serve warm, chocolate chip cookies in the lobby after 4pm! The double-queen rooms & king bed rooms on the front of the hotel are on the frontage road of the freeway with an ocean view over the neighborhood;  the rooms have triple-pane windows to help lessen the road noise...ok for most, but not a light sleeper. The rooms appear to be well-insulated because there was no noise from either of the rooms adjacent to ours. The double-double bed rooms are on the back of the hotel over the pool and spa with a public golf course view.  There is both parking under the building and outside. Manager Response: none

Summary: I found my stay at the Hampton Inn an experience to remember.  It was a last minute vacation in which I didn't have reservations, and to my surprise  I was able to get a wonderful room with an ocean view at a great price. Not only was the staff  very helpful as well as friendly, but the rooms were very clean and comfortable. This is one place I will recommend to others, and  visit as often as I can.

Summary: We stayed at the Hampton in mid-April and we loved it! It was our last night of a week-long stay in California and a great place to relax before the trip home. We had a new, clean suite and all the little touches were appreciated. We have a baby and asked for a crib upon registering. By the time my husband returned to the car to get us and our belongings, a crib was already in our room. This was the only hotel on our whole vacation that had a real crib, rather than a playpen. The hotel also offered a free bbq by the pool that evening and we were pleased to see the breakfast included hot items,as well as dark and regular roast coffee. Every room had a fridge and microwave, and they included popcorn among the complementary coffee, tea, etc. The beds were comfy and we had a great
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a 2-room jacuzzi suite for 7 nights in March 2005.  This suite had a large front bedroom with 2 queens, a bathroom with a separate vanity, and a living room in the back with a pull-out couch, chairs, a table, and a pink jacuzzi tub.  It was a large suite, the largest in the hotel (plenty of room for 2 adults and 4 kids).  What I loved is that so much is free - free high speed internet in the room, free use of the business center, free breakfast (with eggs, sausage, and pancakes), free to-go breakfast at the front desk, free parking.  Food and drink items in the lobby were not overpriced.  Rooms are convenient to parking.  The pool and spa area is small, and surrounded by a parking lot.  We had a large balcony with a golf course view.  Service was good all around.

Summary: We stayed 6 nights at this location and was very pleased with all aspects of the place.  The service was outstanding, the rooms roomy very clean, pool and spa was very nice, breakfast excellent for free contental eggs, bisucut and gravy cerial fruit bagels danishes all you could ask for and more.  At the front desk had 24hr coffee hot chocolate tea and fresh cookies in the evening.  One night they even had a cook out at the pool for all the people staying there(FREE).  The location was a little out of the way but was ok, only a 2minute drive to shopping, dinning, or the beach. We would recommend to anyone and was a great price for a 2room suite $109per night.

Summary Heading: Hampton Inn and Suites was great!
Summary: We stayed two nights at the Hampton Inn and Suites in San Clemente, California.  This place was very easy to find.  In fact it over looks Interstate 5.  When we arrived we were greeted very cordially.  In fact they were watching for us because I had called ahead to let them know we were experiencing some delays with our flight. There was a personal letter waiting for us on our desk, greeting us.  The Suite had a microwave, and a small refridgerator and a small sink with plenty of counter space.  The bathroom was actually two rooms and the sink area  joined the bedroom and Suite. They offered lotion, shampoo and conditioner and a bath gel.  A French door led into the bedroom where we had a balcony room.  From our doors we could see the ocean!  The other side of the Hampton Inn

Summary: You enter the suite through a narrow "living room" that's dark because it doesn't have any windows. Behind that is a narrow bedroom which was said to have "an exceptional ocean view". In fact it faces directly onto the freeway, so you have an exceptional view of Interstate 5, including trucks, cars and a large green sign that's lit up all the night. You will see a sliver of ocean somewhere in the distance, about 2 miles away. Our beds were soft, leaned to one side, and were Double even though the clerk insisted they were Queen. Breakfast options were limited, leaning towards greasy eggs and undercooked pancakes. The web site says you will get 100% satisfaction guarantee. I don't know what they mean by this; we have gotten nothing of the kind.

Summary: Hotel off main highway and our room faced the road but could not hear road noise. Suite size not bad. Breakfast is great down in the dining room overlooking the pool and is made to order and includes ggs. Quiet hotel. Pool is heated and spa is nice with nice landscaping. Not very close to the beach. Only problem we had is that even though the whole hotel is non-smoking, our bathroom smelled like someone had been smoking in it. It had that old stale smoke smell. I called housekeeping and they came and sprayed but did not work.
